verses.verse: Therefore humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due time,
casting all your care upon Him, for He cares for you.
Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil walks about like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour.
Resist him, steadfast in the faith, knowing that the same sufferings are experienced by your brotherhood in the world.
But may the God of all grace, (1 Cor. 1:9; 1 Thess. 2:12) who called us to His eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after you have suffered a while, perfect, establish, strengthen, and settle you.
(Rev. 1:6) To Him be the glory and the dominion forever and ever. Amen.

Farewell and Peace By (2 Cor. 1:19; 1 Thess. 1:1; 2 Thess. 1:1) Silvanus, our faithful brother as I consider him, I have written to you briefly, exhorting and testifying (Acts 20:24) that this is the true grace of God in which you stand.
She who is in Babylon, elect together with you, greets you; and so does (Acts 12:12, 25; 15:37, 39; Col. 4:10; Philem. 24) Mark my son.
Greet one another with a kiss of love. Peace to you all who are in Christ Jesus. Amen.

Greeting the Faithful Simon Peter, a bondservant and (Gal. 2:8) apostle of Jesus Christ, To those who have obtained (Eph. 4:5) like precious faith with us by the righteousness of our God and Savior Jesus Christ:
(Dan. 4:1) Grace and peace be multiplied to you in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord,

as His (1 Pet. 1:5) divine power has given to us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the knowledge of Him (1 Thess. 2:12; 2 Thess. 2:14; 1 Pet. 5:10) who called us by glory and virtue,

(2 Cor. 1:20; 7:1) by which have been given to us exceedingly great and precious promises, that through these you may be ((2 Cor. 3:18)) partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.
Fruitful Growth in the Faith But also for this very reason, (2 Pet. 3:18) giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue, to virtue (2 Pet. 1:2) knowledge,
to knowledge self-control, to self-control perseverance, to perseverance godliness,
to godliness brotherly kindness, and (Gal. 6:10) to brotherly kindness love.
For if these things are yours and abound, you will be neither barren ((John 15:2)) nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
For he who lacks these things is (1 John 2:9-11) shortsighted, even to blindness, and has forgotten that he was cleansed from his old sins.
Therefore, brethren, be even more diligent (2 Cor. 13:5; 1 John 3:19) to make your call and election sure, for if you do these things you will never stumble;
for so an entrance will be supplied to you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.

Peterâ€™s Approaching Death For this reason (Phil. 3:1; 1 John 2:21; Jude 5) I will not be negligent to remind you always of these things, (1 Pet. 5:12) though you know and are established in the present truth.
